alert.note: Alert for Big Island Summit (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 18 at 3:37PM HST until December 20 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT THROUGH 6 AM HST TUESDAY.. ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Light snow accumulations tonight will be followed by periods of heavy snow developing on Monday. Total snow accumulations up to 14 inches. Wind gusts as high as 135 mph will cause significant blowing and drifting of snow. * WHERE...Big Island Summits. * WHEN...Until 6 AM HST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility at times, with periods of zero visibility.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning means significant amounts of snow, sleet, and ice are expected or occurring. Strong winds are also possible. This will make travel very hazardous or impossible. Any travel plans to the summits should be postponed until the threat diminishes.
